bioghist.p: C. Marvin Lang is Professor Emeritus of Chemistry at University of Wisconsin, Stevens Point. Lang has long been active in the affairs of the American Chemical Society (ACS) at the local, regional, and national level including six years service as an elected member of its Board of Directors (1989-1994). He has also served on the Board of Directors of the Chemical Heritage Foundation from 1991 to 1997. In 1991, the ACS agreed to consult on and contribute funds to an exhibit entitled Science in American Life at the Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History (NMAH). Lang was a member of the ACS advisory committee for the Science in American Life exhibit from 1992 to 1993. The exhibit opened in 1994 and remained on view until 2006. The NMAH had control over the exhibit's content, and in the end, the ACS felt that the exhibit's portrayal of chemistry was very negative.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of documents relating to the Science in American Life exhibit. Materials include: correspondence about meetings of a task force on a proposal to create a traveling portion of the Science in American Life exhibit; preliminary outlines of the "hands-on" aspects of the exhibit; draft scripts of the exhibit; and public relations plans.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
